[[File:Example of chest film of acute lung oedema.png|vignette|538x538px|Example of chest film of acute lung oedema]]

properties.question: What is a common radiographic finding in a patient with acute lung oedema due to haemodynamic origin in adult heart failure?
properties.option_a: Clear lung fields with no evidence of fluid accumulation
properties.option_c: Bilateral pulmonary edema with alveolar infiltrates
properties.option_d: Cardiomegaly without evidence of lung pathology
